Articles.Content:
Game is pretty much unplayable.  Crashes in VAB when I am moving things around or when boosting to orbit, actually pretty much any time, but VAB is main culprit.  I have KER, KAS, MechJeb, KIS, SpaceY, Interstellar and Fuel Switch, and maybe one more that escapes me.  Nvidia 960, 16 gb ram, older i7.  Error log says mono.dll is the culprit.  Looks like a memory leak.

Unity Player [version: Unity 5.2.4f1_98095704e6fe]
 
mono.dll caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)
  in module mono.dll at 0023:101195ba.
 
Error occurred at 2016-05-11_232722.
C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP.exe, run by Parents.
39% memory in use.
0 MB physical memory [0 MB free].
0 MB paging file [0 MB free].
0 MB user address space [97 MB free].
Write to location 00800000 caused an access violation.
 
Context:
EDI:    0x00400000  ESI: 0xad5a4dc0  EAX:   0x00010000
EBX:    0x00000001  ECX: 0x00800000  EDX:   0x00000000
EIP:    0x101195ba  EBP: 0x01ecad4c  SegCs: 0x00000023
EFlags: 0x00210206  ESP: 0x01ecad28  SegSs: 0x0000002b
 
Bytes at CS:EIP:
66 0f 7f 01 66 0f 7f 41 10 66 0f 7f 41 20 66 0f

This isn't a memory leak issue - rather, you've been running the 32-bit version of the game, which can only use a maximum of 3.5GB of RAM before it encounters an out-of-memory crash.

To make full use of your 16GB of RAM, run the 64-bit version (KSP_x64.exe) instead.

funfact: he liked all the comments in the other blaming-thread...

...but didnt add some rep to the one actually helping him and solved his problem by showing up his fault - just magically disappeared since then.To sad ppl often jump to blame instead of wondering about their selfes
